intro: Tephrosia luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being elliptical in shape and having a smooth surface. The flowers are usually yellow or pale green, arranged in racemose inflorescences, and are known to attract various pollinators.
